title: Document LAN setup for friends
description: README or quick-start guide covering: network requirements, accepting self-signed certs, supported browsers.

title: Port facilitation engine to TypeScript
description: Port the core facilitation logic from Python to TypeScript. This is the soul of the app. Includes: PromptBuilder (prompts.py - 482 lines of composable system prompt construction with focus overlays, quality modifiers, directiveness dial, custom instructions), SessionManager (context strategy, rolling window, message history), PacingController (6 conversation states, 4 turn decisions, silence detection thresholds, contemplative pause logic), and [HOLD]/[HOLD?] signal detection. Must preserve exact prompt text and pacing timing values.

title: Add HTTPS via reverse proxy
description: Browsers block getUserMedia() on non-localhost HTTP. Set up Caddy (or nginx) as a reverse proxy with TLS. Document self-signed cert workflow for LAN use.

title: App store preparation & polish
description: Final polish for app store submission. Includes: app icon and splash screen, App Store / Play Store metadata (screenshots, description, privacy policy), handle app review requirements (explain microphone usage, explain API key storage), dark/light theme support matching web app, accessibility (VoiceOver/TalkBack compatibility - important for a voice app), haptics, loading states, error handling for network failures.

title: Build Session screen (mobile)
description: Port the web session page to a React Native screen. Core elements: conversation display (scrolling list of user/assistant turns), mic/record button with visual feedback (listening state), session timer, TTS on/off toggle, speaking rate slider, end session button, silence/hold mode indicator. Must handle: keep screen awake during session, background audio session (so TTS plays even if screen locks), haptic feedback on state changes. The session screen is where users spend 95% of their time - it needs to feel seamless.

title: Run behind production WSGI server
description: Replace Flask dev server with gunicorn + eventlet (or gevent) for concurrent Socket.IO connections.

title: Cross-platform mobile app (React Native / Expo)
description: Epic: Build a cross-platform iOS/Android app with the same meditation facilitation functionality as the web app. Use React Native with Expo for shared codebase. The app calls LLM APIs directly, uses platform STT/TTS, and ports the facilitation logic (prompt builder, pacing, hold detection) to TypeScript.

title: Bind server to 0.0.0.0 for LAN access
description: Flask and/or Socket.IO likely bind to 127.0.0.1. Change to 0.0.0.0 so LAN clients can connect. LLM proxy on 8317 can stay localhost if only used server-side.

title: API key management & config (mobile)
description: Secure storage for API keys (Anthropic, OpenAI, OpenRouter, ElevenLabs) using expo-secure-store. Settings screen for: choosing LLM provider and model, entering API keys, selecting TTS engine and voice, default speaking rate, default verbosity. Persist all config with AsyncStorage. First-run onboarding flow to set up at least one LLM provider.

title: Implement text-to-speech (mobile)
description: Implement TTS for meditation responses. Options: (1) expo-speech - wraps platform TTS (AVSpeechSynthesizer on iOS, Android TTS) - free, offline, decent quality. (2) ElevenLabs API - highest quality, costs money, requires network. Start with expo-speech (platform voices). Must handle: configurable speaking rate (default 110 WPM), voice selection, interruptibility (stop speaking when user starts talking), queuing of responses.

title: Audio session & background handling (mobile)
description: Handle the trickiest mobile-specific challenge: audio sessions. iOS requires proper AVAudioSession category configuration (playAndRecord for simultaneous mic+speaker). Android needs foreground service for background audio. Must handle: phone calls interrupting session, app backgrounding (keep listening/speaking), notification sounds, Bluetooth headphones connecting/disconnecting, Do Not Disturb mode. This is the make-or-break reliability task.

title: Handle concurrent Whisper transcription
description: Multiple simultaneous users will bottleneck on Whisper STT. Options: request queue, smaller model option, or OpenAI Whisper API fallback.

title: Implement speech-to-text (mobile)
description: Implement voice capture and transcription on mobile. Options to evaluate: (1) expo-speech-recognition or react-native-voice for platform-native STT (Apple Speech / Android SpeechRecognizer) - simplest, no model downloads, good accuracy. (2) whisper.cpp via react-native bridge for on-device Whisper - more control, works offline, but larger app size (~40-150MB for model). Recommendation: start with platform-native STT, add Whisper option later. Must handle: continuous listening, VAD/silence detection for turn boundaries, background audio interruptions, microphone permissions.

title: Build Setup screen (mobile)
description: Port the web setup page to a React Native screen. Includes: intention text input, 6 preset cards (Pleasant Play, Warmth & Goodwill, Parts Work, Somatic, Freeform, Stillness), attention focus multi-select (Body sensations, Emotions & feeling tone, Inner parts & inner world), facilitator quality multi-select (Playful, Compassionate, Loving, Spacious, Effortless), directiveness slider (0-10), orient-pleasant toggle, verbosity selector (low/medium/high), LLM provider/model picker, and custom instructions. Should feel native and meditative - clean, calm UI.

title: Build History screen (mobile)
description: Port the web history page to a React Native screen. Shows list of past sessions with date, duration, and intention. Tap to view full transcript (user and assistant turns). Swipe to delete. Store sessions in AsyncStorage or SQLite (expo-sqlite). Import/export session data as JSON for compatibility with the web app's session format.

title: Implement LLM provider abstraction (mobile)
description: Create a TypeScript LLM client that supports the same providers as the Python app: Anthropic Claude (direct API), OpenAI, OpenRouter, and Ollama. Use fetch/axios for HTTP streaming. Implement the same context management (rolling window, max_tokens). Start with Anthropic as primary. The CLIProxyAPI provider can be dropped since mobile won't use homebrew Claude proxy.

title: Add basic authentication
description: Simple password gate or basic auth so only intended users can start sessions. Not needed while behind home NAT, but good hygiene before any port-forwarding or tunnel use.

title: Scaffold Expo/React Native project
description: Initialize a new Expo project (managed workflow). Set up TypeScript, navigation (React Navigation), and basic folder structure mirroring the Python app: screens (Setup, Session, History), services (llm, stt, tts, audio), facilitation (prompts, pacing, session). Install core dependencies: expo-av, socket.io-client or direct HTTP, async storage.
